messages.message: Hi team, I got an `docker: no port specified: : <empty>` for webpack log on crafting. Checking the error, `--publish` seems to be unspecified, anyone has ideas?
Hey Alex, did you resolve this?
Yes, and no. Fixed webpack, and replied here https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C05L87V014J/p1747761729781539?thread_ts=1747404563.451399&cid=C05L87V014J

I got this

403 error - restart may fix?
My webpack log is now good
#6 [1/6] FROM 549230430157.dkr.ecr.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/docker-hub/library/node:22.14.0@sha256:e5ddf893cc6aeab0e5126e4edae35aa43893e2836d1d246140167ccc2616f5d7 (http://549230430157.dkr.ecr.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/docker-hub/library/node:22.14.0@sha256:e5ddf893cc6aeab0e5126e4edae35aa43893e2836d1d246140167ccc2616f5d7)

#6 DONE 0.1s
Not sure why the PORT isn't getting set anymore. There was some makefile magic that does that.
Maybe it fails when the image can't be built
Seems node was updated, and the right port wasn't retrieved. Installing new node according to William's steps should fix
